article: This story began when I was a child. I was born in _ . Often we hadn t enough to eat. When never we had some food, Mother often give me her portion. While she was putting her rice into my bowl, she would say, Eat this rice, son! I m not _ . As I grew, Mother her _ her spare time to _ in a river near our house; she hoped that from the fish she caught, she could give me a little bit more _ for my growth. Once she caught just two fish, she made fish soup. While I was eating the soup, Mother sat beside me and ate what was still kept on the _ of the fish I had eaten. My heart was _ when I saw it. So I gave the other fish to her but she immediately _ it and said, I don t _ like fish. Then, in order to pay for my _ , Mother went to a match factory. This helped her get some money to cover my school fees. One wintry night I awoke to find Mother filling the matchboxes by candlelight. _ I said, Mother, go to sleep; it s late; you can _ working tomorrow. Mother smiled and said, Go to sleep, son! I m not _ . When I had to sit my final examination, mother accompanied me. Mother _ for me for hours in the heat of the sun. When the bell rang, I ran to _ her. Mother give me a glass of tea that she had _ . The tea was not as _ as Mother s love. Seeing Mother covered with sweat, I at once gave her my glass and asked her to _ too. Mother said, I m not thirsty! . Now , I m an employer and my _ now is to work hard and to repay my mother for all the _ that she gave me.
